New Records: Ronald Acuña Jr. became the first player in the majors to steal 70 bases and hit 40 home runs in a season
Key Match Events: Ozzie Albies drove in Acuña with a 10th-inning single that clinched home-field advantage throughout the NL playoffs for the Braves
Acuña delivered a run-scoring single that tied the game at 5, then immediately took off for second to swipe his second base of the night and 70th this season
Marcell Ozuna hit a tying homer in the ninth to set the table for Acuña and Albies
Acuña rounded third and barreled for home, diving headfirst across the plate with the run that gave the Braves another comeback victory
Post-Match Reflections: Acuña said through an interpreter, 'It’s really an incredible moment'
Albies said, 'I got goosebumps. A dream come true for him.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves exceeded 3 million fans for the second season in a row and eighth time in team history
The crowd of 37,246 pushed the Braves over 3 million in attendance for the second season in a row
The Braves are on track to pass the Truist Park record of 3,129,931 set a year ago
The Braves are down two starting pitchers in the final days of the regular season
